The internet would become an essential utility like water, electricity, and food. This would mean thats and lack of access to the internet would be considered a violation of human rights.
The government would be responsible for ensuring that all citizens have access to the internet. This would involve building infrastructure and providing subsidies to make internet access affordable.
The internet would become a platform for political and social activism. More people would be able to organize and mobilize for causes they believe in.

The internet would also be a platform for education and knowledge sharing. People would have access to a wealth of information and educational resources, regardless of their location or social status.

The internet would also have a significant impact on the economy. More people would be able to work remotely and start their own businesses, which could lead to increased entrepreneurship and innovation.
